channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024111002
item.description:
Report X-2024111002

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-28T06:19:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-25
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Undeclared Hazmat. No spill. Torn box without "nonspillable" marking, required per 49 CFR 173.159a(c)(2). Two of 10 x 3.2lb Ritar RT6100 vrla sealed batteries (6V10Ah/20hr) missing, one abraded after protruding from pkg, one has bent terminals. No terminal guards/short circuit protection.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a plastic jerry can fell off the catwalk and was dragged by a baggage cart. Causing a puncture and destroying the astra label. The jerry can was placed into a steel salvage package and will be sent out for disposal as hazardous material.

item.title: Report E-2024110456
item.description:
Report E-2024110456

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-21
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal BNA experienced a UN2810 Allyl Amyl Glycolate release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 ounces of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the drum lid due to a loose bung cap. The drum was wiped down, the cap secured and tightened, and a slosh test conducted to ensure no further leaking would occur in transit. The impacted pads and PPE were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024110470
item.description:
Report E-2024110470

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-20
  • City: ANTIOCH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 20, 2024, three (3) 75-pound pails of UN3077 were crushed and released approximately 25-pounds of product to the trailer interior and adjacent items. R+L retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the site. FCE personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove all released product. All impacted materials and the pails were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.
